file_content.text: They could've been friendlies!
You stopped a major prison break. That cargo could've been a ticket off Belsavis for the Esh-kha.
I destroyed the cargo. Turns out it was a smuggler's ship delivering laser drills to some crime lord. You foiled an escape attempt.
The cargo's taken care of.
See? Just like I said.
Thank the stars and thank you... those drills could've been a fast track to freedom for the Esh-kha.
I destroyed the cargo. No telling whose ship it was, though.
The cargo's taken care of.
I still say it was hostile.
Hopefully. At least the cargo's history. There's no telling what the Esh-kha would've managed.
Looks like you won't have to worry about that.
Fortunately, we'll never know.
You have our thanks. Stay safe out there.
Try not to let any more ships crash in the Esh-kha's backyard, huh?
Next time be more careful.
That's a promise. Stay safe out there.
What can I say? I'm the best.
Well, you've got me convinced. Stay safe out there, huh?
If the Esh-kha get their hands on that cargo, there's no telling what they'll pull.
A ship doesn't give ID, we assume aggressor status! Regulations, Nerrick.
Great, the interrogators are here. You gonna lock me up for doing my job?
Master Jedi--please ignore him. We've got ourselves a situation. An unknown ship we shot down crashed in prison territory.
Major! Ignore him, I'm glad you're here. An unknown ship we shot down crashed in prison territory.
Ignore Sergeant Ganno. I know your rep, and I'm glad you're here. An unknown ship we shot down crashed right in prison territory.
If you didn't recognize it, why shoot it down?
You fired on an unknown ship?
It didn't respond when we hailed it. That's suspicious. But then, a friendly ship with comlink trouble wouldn't respond either, you know?
Perhaps your associate should learn to calm himself.
Your friend lacks restraint.
That sergeant should learn some respect.
Tell him to watch his mouth.
Tell your buddy to take the twist out of his shorts.
What's that guy's problem?
Sorry, he's just worked up. Things got a little hairy... truth is, that ship could've been friendly.
What kind of idiot pulls the trigger without identifying the target?
Nice move, knuckleheads.
It all happened so fast! Truth is, we can't be sure it wasn't friendly.
It came in hot and refused to ID itself. We had to assume hostile intent.
Maybe. Problem is, it crashed in Esh-kha territory. Those freaks could stage a breakout with a sheet of flimsiplast and a caf cup.
Someone needs to trash that ship's cargo before they can put it to use. An Esh-kha escape would be bad. As in, sector-wide warfare.
What do you think was on board?
Any idea what the cargo is?
What exactly is an Esh-kha?
Esh-kha?
Alien prisoners--violent, well organized. The brass thinks they're planning something.
If that was a friendly ship, it might hold weapons or a munitions resupply.
But it's hostile and you know it. Probably delivering equipment or droids for some dirtbag's escape attempt.
Either way, it'll go bad really soon. Look, we've got the explosives to demo the cargo. We're desperate here. Can you help?
Your Esh-kha prisoners will not find freedom this day.
I can take care of it.
Me and demo charges go way back.
I'm on it.
I know a little something about prison breaks.
Leave it to me.
Let these Esh-kha try and stop me.
Bloodshed and mayhem--perfect.
Uh... yeah. If we're done, I gotta get my eye on the sky.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Yeah well, I'm sure things will be pretty interesting when the Esh-kha get out and bleed everyone on this planet.
Let's not waste time, then.
Thanks. Now if we're done, I gotta get my eye on the sky.
Look, destroying the cargo is obviously top priority. But if you can, find out if that was a friendly ship, okay? I have to know.
Sorry, we're on alert--can't talk now.
